choices.C:
Provider: L3Out external EPGs -
Consumer: each service EPGs
choices.B:
Provider: each service EPGs -
Consumer: L3Out external EPGs
choices.A:
Provider: each service EPGs -
Consumer: vzAny inside the VRF
choices.D:
Provider: L3Out external EPGs -
Consumer: vzAny inside VRF

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
TCAM utilization is the key here and it can be achieved by vzAny. Since the services are outside and all EPGs requires access, L3Out is provider, vzAny in VRF is consumer.

questions.question_text: An engineer must implement an L3Out within a tenant to allow the reachability to services outside of the Cisco ACI fabric. The requirement is to allow communication from the EPGs in the same VRF to the external services and save TCAM resource utilization. Which contract insertion method must be used to meet these requirements?
Which PIM version must be configured in the Inter-Pod Network to allow broadcast, unknown unicast, and multicast flooding between Cisco ACI pods?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Bidirectional PIM

Selected Answer: C
C. Configure the MTU on the link to be at least 100 bytes larger than the MTU of the ACI fabrics.
Configure the link as a routed subinterface by using VLAN-4.

I think C

choices.A:

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. In a Cisco ACI Multi-Site deployment, traffic fails to pass between Site-A and Site-B, and an engineer troubleshoots the link between ISN-01 and Node-201. Which set of actions establishes connectivity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_B.
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_A.

C. Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_A
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_B.

Export Route Control subnet is for transit route advertisement, so we choose other L3out
External subnet for external EPG is for import security, meaning in simple words to apply a contract, so we choose it on the same L3Out, as the source traffic comes into the fabric from Ext EPG/external network

choices.E:
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_A.
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_ B.
choices.B:
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_A.
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_B.
choices.C:
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_A
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_B.
choices.A:
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_B.
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_A.
choices.D:
Configure 172.18.1.0/24 with scope Export Route Control subnet under L3out_B.
Configure 192.168.1.0/24 with scope External subnet for external EPG under L3out_A.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which two sets of actions must be taken to permit subnet 192.168.1.0/24 to communicate with subnet 172.18.1.0/24 using Cisco ACI fabric? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
host route advertisement on the bridge domains se usa en la topologia de Multipod:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/4-x/L3-configuration/Cisco-APIC-Layer-3-Networking-Configuration-Guide-42x/Cisco-APIC-Layer-3-Networking-Configuration-Guide-42x_chapter_0100.html

Para la topologia de Multisite se requiere new stretched external EPG to the existing L3Outs. Un host route por BD isola por POD pero en Multisite se requiere algo mas especifico ya que el trabaja con replicas de paquetes entre el spine elegido hacia los demas.

Answer A:
"leading to the creation of an asymmetric traffic path. This behavior may lead to the drop of traffic in designs in which independent stateful firewalls are deployed between the fabrics and the WAN. This problem can be solved by leveraging a new functionality, supported on border leaf L3Outs from Cisco ACI Release 4.0(1), which allows advertising the most specific host-route information to the WAN"

choices.C: Implement a policy-based redirect using a service graph.
choices.A: Configure host route advertisement on the bridge domains.
choices.D: Add a new stretched external EPG to the existing L3Outs.
choices.B: Enable anycast services to the firewalls in both fabrics.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must implement a solution to ensure that ingress and egress traffic flows are symmetric for all stretched bridge domains in the customer multisite architecture. Which configuration accomplishes this goal?
